_description: The Hours of the Cross, interspersed in the English Prymer — seven stanzas of 8 short lines, or of four long lines rhyming aabb, the passages often followed by refrain-like ‘We worchipe the crist and blesse to the / For bi the holi crois thou hast for bought the worlde’

Bod85.First Lines:
The wisdom of the fadir the trewthe of the hy kingGod and man was
                    taken in the dawenyngOf hys knowen disciplis he was sone forsakeSold
                    and put to peyne mankynde sauf to make…
Bod85.Last Lines:
…Whit spiceri he was beried holi writ to fulfulleThenke we
                    sadli on is deþ that shal saue vs from helle

CamStJohn192.First Lines:
The wysdome of the fadir the trewthe of the heye kynggod and man
                    was taken in the morwenyng…
CamStJohn192.Last Lines:
…Wiþ spicerye he was biryed holy writ to fulfillethenk we
                    sadly on his deeth that schal saue us fro helleWe worschipe thee cryst and
                    blesse to theffor be thi deeth thow hast bowȝt the worlde
                    aȝee
CamStJohn192.Note:
Seven 6-line stanzas, aabbcc, including two-line refrain as last two
                    lines above; written as prose, interspersed with prose text.
